website_summaries.verdict: A reasonably sturdy model with mostly handy features. A few minor flaws can be problematic, but the pros outweigh the cons.
pros: Straightforward design, snap to open/close, plus 2 tool pouches  – convenient features for gardeners-on-the-go who like to keep their gear organized
cons: Seat position seems on the high side
Some users find the tool pockets too narrow

customer_reviews.title: Not built well enough to support a grown man
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for two weeks then the plastic support broke and it is now unusable. I weigh 205
customer_reviews.author: john selvidge

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Garden Helper!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help us work around the garden. And I love the design! It works fine both for sitting and for kneeling, and is very sturdy -- I'm a big girl. I've even used to do work under the sink! And it folds up easily for storing it when you're not using it. Great little item!
customer_reviews.author: Challender

customer_reviews.title: Great find!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 65 yearold avid gardener sister. She's in great health, but is finding getting up and down from the ground while gardening isn't as easy as it used to be. She LOVES this product!!! It is very sturdy, yet lightweight. It serves two vital functions: a.) it's a great seat or kneeler to sit/kneel on while leaning over in the garden and b.) the sturdy arms assist her in going to a standing position with ease. It folds up easily. Even if you're a younger person, I'm guessing this product would still be very useful. Great gift idea for gardeners!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I won’t hurt my knee and can comfortably garden while seated.
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a knee injury and thought I wouldn’t be able to work in my gardens, however with the garden seat I was able to most of my gardening while seated. I then purchased two for friends and they too are extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Kooser

customer_reviews.title: Strudy and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. It's sturdy, but light enough to pick up easily and move around the garden. Comfy seat, perfect height to sit on and bend over to weed. I'm 5'5". I wish I'd bought this bench years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best garden kneeler/seat
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I hesitated on purchasing this garden kneeler/seat! It is an aging Gardner's delight! Love everything about it. It is portable (folds down flat) it allows you to sit and rest for a moment, flip it over & you have a firm kneeling pad, and the sole reason I purchased it: I can get up by pushing myself up on the "legs!" This is the one, ladies*****+!!
customer_reviews.author: DonnaMcM.

customer_reviews.title: So Handy for the Garden!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had problems doing hardly any garden work last summer until I purchased this. Using the Garden Kneeler I was able to pick enough green beans to can and for our family to eat. I could even lean over to pull some of the weeds in the garden. And if I wanted to sit and enjoy being in the middle of the garden it was perfect! I left it out in the garden all summer and although the material faded it is still in great condition. I think it is one of my favorite purchases and will never want to be without one again. The side pockets were so useful for storing gardening hand tools.
customer_reviews.author: postmark

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom for Christmas. She has been using this for a few months and loves it! She is in her 60's and when its nice out she gardens basically every day. She has knee trouble so needs a lot of cushion, this is great to provide her some relief while she is kneeling and gardening. The bars on the side are also great to use to push up to a standing position. She keeps tools in the side pockets which is a great bonus. She loves this and says its easy to fold, carry and store!!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: It's the best garden accessory
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical after I purchased it because it boasted it holds 390 pounds and I'm six feet and 275 pounds. It's the best garden accessory, and I also use it at the foot of my bed to assist me in putting on my sox. I also used it to stretch my sciatic nerve on both of my legs. I highly recommend this product. Made my gardening a little bit more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: It works. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Seems fairly-well made. I don't fold and unfold it, I just store it in open position between uses. It's a little wobbly but feels stable enough when in use. It definitely makes getting up from an on-the-knees gardening position much easier, and worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Shilo

customer_reviews.title: Must have gardening tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for gardening! It did make me a little time to figure out all the way to fold it. But now they I can utilize all its features it makes planting, pulling weeds and picking vegetables much easier!!
customer_reviews.author: Liz a.

customer_reviews.title: Ohuhu Garden Kneeler and Seat with 2 Bonus Tool Pouches
customer_reviews.text: What a life saver if you work in flower beds. This has been extremely helpful without all the bending and trying to find your gardening tools; the two pouches is a nice feature and glad someone thought about putting them on the Kneeler. This is the first thing I pull out in the spring & fall of the year when working in my flower beds. You can't go wrong with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mora Richardson

customer_reviews.title: gardening made easy
customer_reviews.text: I'm 83 years old and find weeding the garden so much easier with the Ohuhu garden kneeler. The handles are sturdy and makes getting up and down a breeze. I like the pockets for my tools.
customer_reviews.author: R.C. White

customer_reviews.title: Company stands by their product
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted. Bought it for my mom for mothers day and she’s used it everyday since it got delivered. Obviously it’s not meant for everyday use because it snapped off at one of the welds. Poorly made. Wouldn’t buy it again. **7/26: I contacted the seller, told them my issue and they stand by their products! They immediately sent my mother another one. So so happy. 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Clare Richardson

customer_reviews.title: ... third one of these I have owned and have loved each and every one
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these I have owned and have loved each and every one, each one lasting about 3-4 YEARS! This one, however, hasn't lasted through one single gardening season. I began using it in the Spring of this year, and it's June and it's falling apart. The frame sandwiched in between the cushion seat and kneeling pad is made of flimsy plastic and has broken so that my knees fall through when I kneel on it. If I recall, on previous models that plastic piece was metal which was very strong and durable. I'll get another, but not from Amazon, but my local nursery. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lift Up
customer_reviews.text: I love the mobility. I wish I had seen this years ago. It is wider than the usual kneeling pad. One of the best features is the hand rest, which I use to get up.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Rehmer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to save wear and tear on the knees and back. It has worked well above expectations. As a kneeler, the handles make it easier to get up and down. The padded base/seat is a plus. As a seat, it is sturdy and comfortable. Picking my currant bushes is much easier with this product. I was a bit skeptical about the sturdiness claims, but I am very impressed. I am well on the dark side of 250 lbs and haven't had an issue in a full year of use. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save’s the knees
customer_reviews.text: I love to garden however my knees do not ! Best product ever. My knees are protected from the hard ground and when I go to get up I use the side rails.. if I need to have a set I flip it! I’m about 5’9 200 pounds and it works great for me. Best purchase I have made for myself with gardening
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Cook

customer_reviews.title: For lightweights only
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in May 2018. This kneeler/seat was a great idea but it is only made for small light women or men. Product claims to hold 330# but my "mere" 200# + or - 5# broke the seat on about the 4th or 5th use (see attached photos) and dumped me over backwards. The product folds up easily and is easy to maneuver for the tasks at hand but is not built well at all. When it broke it was sudden and unexpected and the seat just caved in completely exposing the styrofoam within and the inadequate hardware holding it together. Therefore, the foldability and maneuverability get 5 stars but the sturdiness rates a big fat zero.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to use in the garden and after a few uses, the cheap welds broke and the unit collapsed under her. Do not buy this item, its cheaply made and can put you at risk!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Garden bench
customer_reviews.text: This garden bench, is just what I needed. I am 73 and am starting to get bad knees, other than that I am very active. I like to do a little gardening, and other chore, chores around the house. Because of the bench/knee pad I was able to repair the corner of our brick house, replacing one of the missing bricks and tuck pointing a lot of the ones where the mortor was missing. I can't say that this bench made me a master mason but I certainly was able to sit and get up and down easily. Very well made and collapsed to a small size thaT I was able to hang it on wall in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: eyeofthebeholder

customer_reviews.title: Not really for larger people
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from a different seller and it broke immediately (the plastic reinforcement between the foam pads). This one has lasted a just little bit longer. I weigh 250 pounds and that seems like too much weight for these kneelers. They used to have a sturdier plywood panel between the foam pads, and my old one lasted me over 14 years. I will probably take this one apart and replace the broken plastic with a piece of plywood (I haven't seen any for sale that are made with the plywood). So if you are a heavier individual, you should be aware of this issue!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight construction. Disappointing. Bought one 5-6 years ago. Same design, much sturdier
customer_reviews.author: Richard George

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting down to do weeding etc
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Only suggestion is about the bonus tool holder. There are three narrow pockets, which are too narrow even to hold a pair of secateurs. I would redesign the tool pocket to have two wider pockets rather than the three very narrow pockets that it has now. I think the only "tool" that would fit in it right now would be a knife. Certainly not a trowel or anything else that you might use for weeding.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy N

customer_reviews.title: DON'T KNEEL WITHOUT IT
customer_reviews.text: I've recently had a hip replacement, but love to garden and am busy cleaning out my house. Bending down is not advised yet, and kneeling makes it difficult to get up unless there is a support. This kneeler is perfect! It's light enough to carry around the house and outdoors with me, easy to fllip over and comfortable to kneel on. The only reason there's not a 5 star rating is because it seems a bit flimsy, although it hasn't ever collapsed on me and does support my 160 pounds. I would recommend it for the price and definitely the function!
customer_reviews.author: L. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully solid, and great value.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rave about this enough...sturdy -useful vs cost...hands down a great deal. I am a large short woman. (250lbs and 5'3) and i feared this things would collapse on me. It has been perfect. i sit on it solidly..(a broad man might find the seat narrow) I kneel on it comfortably but the handles to help me up are a huge blessing. It folds perfect to hang on a hook with my garden tools. the only downside...THE POUCHES ARE USELESS. barely fit the tool handle..not deep enough or wide enough...they flip down when tools are in...so i just removed them.
customer_reviews.author: mapleleafmomof3

customer_reviews.title: Knee Saver
customer_reviews.text: If you garden and work on your knees a lot, this kneeler will help to save your knees. It is much better than the padded kneeling garden mats I used previously. Plus, one of the greatest benefits is the legs on the kneeler that can be used to help you stand back up when used for kneeling. The kneeler is also plenty sturdy if you use it as a sitting bench. My only negative point is the tool pouches: they are sturdy but it is hard to keep your tools inside when you fold the bench. I don't find them very useful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Not just Yet, but good idea!
customer_reviews.text: Not quit as sturdy or as steady as I had hoped. Whole unit had all joints loosened up by the fifth or sixth time of use. No longer feels as sturdy. Go back to the drawing room and redesign the way the joints meet, and your good idea might be a success! It’s clever, just needs to be tested more in people up to your weight recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah F

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Just a little wobbly laterally
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just a little wobbly laterally, and the release lever to fold/unfold is not only a little hard to squeeze but you can get your fingers caught in the wrong place too. With familiarity I'm sure these problems would be diminished. But I do like it, all in all. I actually don't have a garden... I use it around the house! An impromptu seat or kneeler is always handy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift for a gardener! My elderly mother loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My gardening guru mother, aged 73, was THRILLED to receive this as a Christmas gift. She spends hours a day on her knees and this is a major upgrade from the foam knee pads she has been using. It is lightweight and easy to carry, and easy to fold up. You just flip it upside down to switch between a bench and a kneeler, so there is no picky adjusting needed. From a gifting perspective, I was so happy to give her something very practical and pretty “big” that was also affordable. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deeber

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening tool
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this seat/kneeler. Very easy to set up as either seat or kneeling platform. Well constructed. Folds up completely so easy to store. Comfortable even when using for several hours. Good height for sitting while performing different yard chores. Love the addition of the tool holders on each side. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Ohuhu Garden Kneeler
customer_reviews.text: I pulled out my back from bending over while standing to pull weeds from my yard. I decided I needed something where I could use better posture to pull weeds and prune my plants. This garden kneeler is lightweight and I've used it both to sit on and reversed it to kneel on. It has allowed me to work more easily and without pain in my yard. My back says "thank you".
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: Works, but countruction is a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Is functional, but construction is a little flimsy. You need to lower your knees gently onto the kneeler, otherwise it looks like it would break. This could potentially be a great product, if more support was provided for the kneeler. ( eg 2 horizontal bars on each side of kneeler). Also, the grab handles should be recessed with a rubber grip. When you flip it over, you often get your hands dirty. Frequent friction/contact surfaces loose paint and rust. Tool pouches should be an option, as you may not use them.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great help with kneeling
customer_reviews.text: These are sold for use outside in the garden but I got it to use indoors when I'm cleaning or need to get at something in a lower cupboard. I used to have one but sold it when I left my house & garden behind. It never occured to me that I would want it to use indoors but that's exactly what I plan to do. It's not just outside that I now find myself needing help kneeling/getting up. I am making a padding to cover the legs so they don't scratch my hardwood floors. It would've been nice if that was already available for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed.  Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in May 2019. Due to rain I didn’t start using it until mid June and even then only once or twice a week. Product claims to support up to 330lbs. I am a woman and weigh 135lbs and used it only to kneel on. The poor construction didn’t even support my weight and cracked after only 5 or 6 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: broken already
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. All metal construction makes you think it will last, but the most important part...the frame that holds the kneeling pad (which is subject to all your weight) is made of plastic. Rated for over 300 lbs, my 230 was too much for it. After a few uses, I heard some cracking noises and found that the plastic frame had broken. Now its in the trash. Great idea, but not built well and certainly does not support the weight ratings in the ad.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mangiapane

customer_reviews.title: Hard seat and horizontal sway
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how this Kneeler will hold up as there is a slight side to side sway when using it as a seat. Weight limit is not an issue. I am keeping it and hoping for the best. The seat and kneeling cushions are very hard. I will need to use more cushioning to use this to kneel on for sure. The seat will not be comfortable for extended use. I can put a cushion on it but should not have to.
customer_reviews.author: a buyer

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. Very sturdy, yet lightweight. I bought one for myself and gave one as a gift to my mother. Excellent for gardeners arthritic knees and hips. Also makes a handy extra seat around the fire, in a pinch. Four stars instead of five because of the folding mechanism. It works fine but it is very easy to catch/pinch your hand in this. Both myself and the kids have been pinched, not too hard, we didn't get cut, but it is a watch out. For me, the tool pouches are kind of useless, because I use this as a kneeler most often, but they are velcro and remove easily. Overall, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Triple J

customer_reviews.title: A must have for gardening
customer_reviews.text: Have used it extensively over the last three days. I laughingly refer to it as a “walker” for your garden activities...I have bad knees and its hard to get up off the ground once I get there to weed and work in my flower beds. This stool is well built and allows me to get up easily and its also well built with steel tubing. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my gardening wife who, due to an injury, had to wear a full foot boot for several weeks during prime weeding season. She used it both as a kneeler and a seat and she liked how strong but lightweight it is. I was also impressed with the quality of construction and how it was ready to use right out of the box. It even folds flat easily and fits conveniently into her rectangular yellow (former largest Preen container) weed bucket. The only design suggestion would be to make one of the tool pockets large enough to hold a water bottle. I would definitely buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ellis

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I love gardening but I have back problems. With this trusty gadget, I don't have to worry about my back. I can sit and pull weeds and plant flowers (with it in the upright position) or I can turn it upside down and kneel to get even closer. I love it! It seems to be made of sturdy materials and it can hold my 5'8 200lb frame so I'm thinking I'll be using this for many years!
customer_reviews.author: carolyn larson

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned that the product would not be strong enough for my 230 pound frame. However after using it several times I am surprisingly satisfied with the way it performs. It's very strong and very comfortable to use I would buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. LaCasse

customer_reviews.title: GOOD AND STURDY
customer_reviews.text: good and sturdy- seems a little wider than others- will last me for years- and helps me get up by using side handles- tool carriers are okay but I flip the seat a lot depending on my position so have to take tools off and put back on when seat flipped- a bit of a bother so will not use much
customer_reviews.author: Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Being able to work in the garden and not have to worry about your back is very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I need it to do!!! Being able to work in the garden and not have to worry about your back is very nice!!! I also use this when I have to feed my daughter when she is in her high chair. It puts me right at her eye level! PROS: Light, comfortable, removable storage pouches, sturdy CONS: I have one tiny con that seems like a slight design flaw. When you put tools inside the pouches, they have a tendency to flip over and spill your tools on the ground. I would suggest putting something on the sides to prevent the pouches from flipping over. Minor inconvenience, but great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good product/slight complaint
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I bought the very same product from another source years ago and liked it. I am 70 years old and getting up and down in the yard isn't as easy as it once was. It works very well. My only complaint...and it is a small one...after several years of use the padding which forms the kneeling/sitting platform is beginning to come loose from the frame. Keep in mind...I have used this product for several years and I weight close to 240 lbs. so a separation of the padding is (in my mind) not that surprising. Still a good product...that's why I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. easily supports my 200 ib + weight
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. easily supports my 200 ib + weight. Side handles will support my weight allowing me to get up from kneeling. Only problem was the release bar on one side wouldn't latch because of excessive paint in the latching area. This was easily fixed with a file to remove the paint. Seat is very narrow front to back, make sure your butt is centered on the seat before sitting, else it could tip over backward. This will probably only happen once! Appears to be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: P Tay

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband does lots of yard work, but recently injured his back and is unable to kneel on the ground and get back up easily. Someone at my gym suggested a garden kneeler and this one had great reviews. It works just great. He said it makes getting up and down so much easier because he is able to grab the handles and push himself up. Seems plenty sturdy and it basically just folds to store. Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite garden helper
customer_reviews.text: This little bench was so perfect, we had to buy another one so hubby would stop taking mine! It's light weight and ideal for sitting and trimming my tall perennials or picking vegetables. Personally, I don't like to kneel (hurts my knees) which is why the bench suits my needs. They also come in handy for extra seating when friends pop in unexpectedly. It comes already assembled. Open the box, pull it out and viola! it springs open! Too cool!! It will also fold up for easy storage but I have a feeling we'll be using them year round!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia N

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 92 year old father who has very bad knees due to arthritis. The so-called cushions has in which you need a lan were made more out of boogie board material then soft cushion. Even though my dad is 92 years old he's very mobile he found this hard to unfold. Also it was hard for him to push himself up which was the main reason why we purchase this item
customer_reviews.author: Vic Berardino

customer_reviews.title: Gift for aging, avid gardener.
customer_reviews.text: She loves it and doesn't know why we didn't get one sooner. If she were reviewing it, she might have specific things to say about various aspects, but as the gifter all I can tell you is if she's doing any gardening, this is with her.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Kneeling pad breaks
customer_reviews.text: Very useful concept, easily maneuverable, and very handy but the plastic layer in the middle of the two pads that make the "sandwich" of the kneeler pad and seat pad breaks after repeated use. I have had two of these and both broke when kneeling on it with one knee while starting to stand up. I weigh 210 pounds, so for anyone over 200 pounds, the product should be made sturdier. After noting my concern, the vendor kindly reached out to me to apologize for my experience and courteously sent me a full reimbursement, which was greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: a great back and knee saver
customer_reviews.text: This item is light, easy to fold and carry, and supports my weight (along with the pressure exerted when standing up). I am confident using it. It is best when you are going to work in the same area for a bit - to move it you need to stand up and re-place it and then sit/kneel. But, when you're weeding a patch, or planting an area, it is fabulous. I have even used it when I am painting.
customer_reviews.author: divinemskTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this garden kneeler. it's very sturdy. It's also easy to fold up, once I figured it out. It's comfortable to use while I'm out weeding. the pockets on the sides could be a little bit bigger, but I garden with a basket next to me anyway so it's not a big deal for me. I may remove the pockets completely just so they're not in the way as I flip it over from the allure to seat. It's just a hassle to move them from one bar to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Davis

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gardening tool!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband and he loves it! He enjoys working in the garden but has a little difficulty getting up after weeding (he's 75). This is perfect. The arms give him support to get up from a kneeling position and the bench is a good height for working in our raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Eddy Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these for my sister. She used it for a year and loves it...I was hoping she'd get the hint and get one for me. Oh, well! I got another one for myself and, even though I was careful, it broke the first time I kneeled on it. It says it should be good to some 330 pounds and I'm less than 2/3 that. So...we've got one great experience and one not-so-great experience.
customer_reviews.author: WileyP

customer_reviews.title: Strong, but a tipping hazard
customer_reviews.text: This garden seat is sturdy. But, I think it should be a few inches wider to make it more stable. You have to sit forward on it. If you sit back, you could easily tip over backward. It does unfold easily. There is no assembly required. It is comfortable. Again, I feel like it is too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Lilith

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Garden Kneeler and Seat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this seat for garden work. It is sturdy and easy to fold. It will make weeding the garden so much easier. My knee replacement doesn't let me kneel, so I appreciate the seat. This seat is also being used inside for working on crossword puzzles! It is comfortable seating for long periods of time and easy to maneuver to change positions and does not take up a lot of room. Thinking about buying another!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Taschner

customer_reviews.title: Handy little thing.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this much yet (the wife was thingking I'd use it cuz I'm the one whose down on the ground the most, working) but it's sturdy enough. The wife found it as a handy chair. The pouches are handy, I guess, a bit stiff cuz of the newness but well built. So, it is easy on the knees, helps you stand up with the arm assist's and it's not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Pan_dal_us

customer_reviews.title: It was comfortable to use as a seat and as a kneeler
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for my mom to use in the garden. It was delivered on time and packaged well. The bench arrived fully assembled and ready to go. The tool pouches on both sides of the bench are included. It was comfortable to use as a seat and as a kneeler. My toddler has decided to take over the bench and uses it in the kneeling position as a balance beam. It is light enough that she can move it on her own so I know my mom will be able to move it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Catsmeow

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: One of the leg supports bent and tossed my wife, Who isn't a large person by any means.
customer_reviews.author: david munson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bargain
customer_reviews.text: As a "senior" gardener, I can no longer stoop to dig or pull weeds. This allows me to sit and bend over my work. I have seen ads for similar ones at double the price. The only difference I can see is theirs have better pouches. This one has too-small pockets in the pouches. I took out the stitching between the pockets and works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: You can't live without this
customer_reviews.text: I use this not for gardening but for cleaning my pool skimmers, the concrete is terrible on my knees. I'm no longer 20 & kneel on the pad then the legs help with getting up, it's grand. I'm on my 2ed one in 15 years so I'll say they hold up, left one out in a Michigan winter and it survived. I can & do use this year round.
customer_reviews.author: SPKrueger

customer_reviews.title: Ohuhu Garden Kneeler
customer_reviews.text: This kneeler has a foam core pad attached to the frame. I really like that. It doesn’t slip or move when you kneel on/off it. I’m disabled with MS & getting up/ down is my issue. I’ll Probably never use it as a bench. The storage sleeves are nice, but to be honest- i’l Never use them. I need a firm grip on handle & they’re in the way. I have a tool/ weed bucket.
customer_reviews.author: SWEETP2U

customer_reviews.title: ... this 6 months ago for my Florida home and love it! It has enabled me to get back ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 6 months ago for my Florida home and love it! It has enabled me to get back to gardening without fears of getting up once I get down on my knees due to arthritis and back issues. I've also found it helpful to use when indoors when needed to get down to scrub floors and clean out lower cabinets. Wish that it had rubberized protectors for indoor use to prevent scratching of floors. Was going to order another for use at my home in WI, however, I have noticed that the price has increased by 50% since October 2017. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: mike novak

customer_reviews.title: Breaking apart
customer_reviews.text: While I like the design of this device, it is lacking in sturdiness. After a few short weeks, the piece between the kneeling pads is breaking apart rather badly. It should have lasted more than a few weeks. Considering the cost, I would not recommend this unit. Too bad, because I did find it useful and a help when doing yard work. I contacted their customer support with this issue. They responded promptly and expeditiously sent a replacement item. I am hopeful this one will perform better. I am happy with their response and find that commendable.
customer_reviews.author: edward bielawski

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: Such a game changer for me. High quality stable product. The bench use is great for odd jobs around the house (do not stand on this). When turned upside down to use as a kneeler it works like a charm. I have a terrible time getting back up from the floor but this makes it trouble free...just like when I was young. The fact that it folds up is a plus. The 5 stars are well deserved.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S..

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: Breaks easy. Knee pads separate, then you knee l directly on steel. Warranty request via ohuhu does not respond.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Trausch

customer_reviews.title: Helps my knees
customer_reviews.text: I'm 87YO and noticed that I can't get down on the floor to play with my dog. I added this bench to use to make my hips 2 toes more flexible. Helps sitting on your tailbone properly. Effects digestion. I actually turned it upside down and I was able to get on my knees in my home for the first time. I have to do this as a slow process since I live alone. I've fallen 3 times this year and luckily got up but no more accidents please.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel Jean Saltz

customer_reviews.title: Neat bench!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little bench for garden work. Was better quality than what I expected and makes gardening so much easier. I leave it on my porch and use it for other purposes. It is one neat little bench and has caught the eye of others wanting to know where I got it. I happily tell them so I'm sure i will be seeing it among my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great item for work in the garden and around the house. I have used this for washing the floors, weeding, and any other jobs that require kneeling! It is great for getting up with the side arms and very handy for sitting when weeding or working on things in the yard/garden etc. Great for people with difficulties getting up and down and saves the knees! Recommended this to a friend with lupus and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: wentwhereTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dont just think of this as an outdoor use product. works for many different purposes.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Very heavy duty. Im a big guy, and it holds me just fine. I have leg issues do to health, so have trouble getting up from ont he ground. this is perfect, there's the to legs, when its turned over, that I can grab hold of and help push myself up. This is even great for when I have to get down on the floor inside the house, to look for something in the bottom cabinets in the kitchen, under a bed, whatever. .
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sain

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what another web site has.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Easy to open (no assembly required) and sturdy enough for what I wanted to use it for. I originally bought for outside garden use, but tried it out indoors, and decided to buy another one for outside.. Helps save my knees from access to lower cabinets and under the bed storage access. Shipped early and arrived in great condition (both units). Saved about 15 dollars from the 'other' web site, and no S&H. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. MacCabe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this kneeler! Easy to set up, lightweight yet sturdy. Knee padding is wonderful and so easy to flip over for a seated project or just to rest for a few minutes. Folds back up easily and can slide it back in the box it came in for easy storage. Love the side pockets and that they come off. This has so made my gardening more enjoyable and has saved by body from strain! I so recommed this product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Achee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and seems well made.
customer_reviews.text: Just got my stool in. A bit dissapointed as the descriptions and picture both stated that it would come with bonus 2 tool kit bags and mine only came with one. I have not used it yet, however it opens and closes nice and easily. The seat seems quite durable and overall the piece feels sturdy. It is on the smaller side for the width, I would have liked the seat to be even a few inches wider as you may need to adjust your bottom to feel balanced. For the price however it does seem worth it. Can't wait to try this out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I’m an old geezer who still enjoys gardening but I’ve had a couple of mishaps when I lost my balance and had a dickens of a time getting myself into a standing position. I keep this sturdy, well-built piece of equipment near me to help get out of tough spots without assistance. And I’ve found I can comfortably kneel when I need to and get back up with no trouble. The Ohuhu helps me maintain mobility and independence.
customer_reviews.author: Kisle

customer_reviews.title: Made a great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my husband as a gift and he thought it was weird at first but now really likes and appreciates it! He's used it in the yard, the garden, and working on his truck. He's also used it inside the house as a stool when he is fixing things and it makes me happy that I picked a good present! It's well made and very sturdy. It folds up very compactly. And the pouches are removable.
customer_reviews.author: 00_jackie_00

customer_reviews.title: Broke within one day
customer_reviews.text: Although I had high hopes for this product, one side broke off within one day of use. It was comfortable - just what I wanted, but it's no good if it's broken.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I had my Gardeners Supply bench for ten years. Cheaped out on this one and will be surprised if it lasts one season. Rickety and just -well - cheap. Do yourself a favor and get the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: V. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Helps out back
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Helps my back. Tool pouch is not deep enough. Most tools just fall out somewhere in the yard. Frustrating to find them. Foam is petty hard. I can use it with my artificial joints, have to be careful. The metal that holds the foam in can hit my knees if I am not. Overall happy with it. Don't think it is worth the price tag really.
customer_reviews.author: D. Compton

customer_reviews.title: Help when help is needed.
customer_reviews.text: Getting up and down at my age is an issue. This product made me look forward to a little yard work! Sturdy, lightweight, and saved my dignity! I can sit on it and turn it upside down to help me get up and down. Pockets are great for keeping yard tools handy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Garden kneeling stool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas. Nice little gardening helper. Only one complaint, tool pockets don't work very well in kneeling position. He has a hard time getting up from a kneeling position and this really helps. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pickens

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad for Father's Day because he likes to garden. He used it for an hour and the seat part broke. He is 200 pounds so there is no reason this kneeler should have broke. Try buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Armour

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to move around and fold to store. Nice and sturdy although the pockets or sides fall off easily. After using it this summer, if I could change something I wish that you could adjust the seat to a lower position, it's too high for me to sit on and weed. I've tumbled off three times trying to sit on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered this long ago. It is saving my knees, and is such a help to get in a standing position. I'm thinking about getting another one so I don't have to carry this back and forth from different garden spots.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerite

customer_reviews.title: Awesom
customer_reviews.text: This an excellent product for those of us that can’t get up from the ground easily. I will sit for a while then flip over to kneel and with the legs I can hold onto them and stand much easier!
customer_reviews.author: UMnMC

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardeners who need a helping hand!
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother still works diligently in her garden, but was having trouble getting back up once she got down to her knees. This has helped tremendously and she has been out even more often with its help. She can sit on it as a bench or flip it over for a knee pad with handles to help push herself back to standing. I love that it's given her more independence in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Gardening Tool
customer_reviews.text: I don't love gardening but this bench makes it so much easier. Great for kneeling, great for sitting. Sturdy but not too heavy to carry around. Firm pad for these old knees. The tool holders are pretty useless, since I flip the bench frequently from sit to kneel, but not a big drawback. Use them elsewhere. Very pleased with my new favorite gardening tool :-)
customer_reviews.author: bunk b

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I used it a good bit while cleaning ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I used it a good bit while cleaning out a flower/tree garden in the front yard. Saved my back and my knees for an hour and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

customer_reviews.title: Great simple gardening accessory
customer_reviews.text: I got this item to help my wife with her gardening activities which have caused problems due to arthritic knees. She loves it. What I discovered was it really helps me since Ihave trouble getting up from the ground. The convenient hand grips have now eased that problem, so I no longer fear getting down to do some tasks on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic item. 2 in 1. Has saved my back and knees. Makes working with anything much easier for my back. I love gardening but with having severe back issues this has allowed me to be much more comfortable so I can enjoy my gardening.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Allows my Father to Continue Gardening
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my 85 year father who loves to work his vegetable garden. After 3 Heart attacks and two bouts with cancer, and two replacement hips, his body is failing him. The garden kneeler enables him to get down on his hands and knees to weed around his plants, and then be able to push himself to a standing position without the assistance of others. He couldn’t be happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a large garden and could use a place to sit while weeding or working for long periods of time. The bench came assembled, which was nice, and it is sturdy enough for my husband, who's a tall, muscular person, to sit on without shaking or tipping. The pockets are convenient for holding tools. It finds up easily and didn't take much place to store.
customer_reviews.author: MamaGhostBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great product - would definitely recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it to garden...besides sitting, it also helps me to get up without looking or feeling awkward! I had been looking for this item on other sites of specialty books up to a price of $69 plus shipping. Truly a good deal and I would highly recommend this product to everyone! l It is very sturdy!!!
customer_reviews.author: SamsFurryKids

customer_reviews.title: Gardener’s Friend
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have the greatest knees and bending over while gardening takes a toll. This little tool is great for both sitting and kneeling. Bonus with the kneeling position is you have the bars to use when standing up. Has a fairly small footprint, but level ground is helpful for use. The tool pouch is fairly useless if you flip from seating to kneeling positions.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Will rust
customer_reviews.text: Solid build. Held my overweight butt well (270lbs). Helps to get up and down in the garden of where ever you are working. The kneeling areas are pretty hard but help. The metal will begin rusting upon use as the paint is thin. Could use rubber on bottoms to insulate the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Durable and light-weight
customer_reviews.text: Wife gardens and loves this seat/kneeler for support as she tends her gardens. She especially likes the seat when she weeds within a ground cover area like ivy, pachysandra, etc. The slender tubular legs don't mash down a large area. Also, it extends her reach into the covered area when she rests her upper body on the seat and reaches forward to weed or plant. No cons'
customer_reviews.author: Walter L.

customer_reviews.title: This kneeler if perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: After having trouble with my original order, the customer service department of this company really tried to make things better! I'm giving them an A+ for effort and making things better. The kneeler is great and the replacement is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My back does't hate me as much anymore
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I haven't bought one of these before. Although I don't sit on it, I flip it and kneel on it. My back does't hate me as much anymore. :) It has two tool holders that hang on the handle bars - the pockets are skinny, I'd rather have two wider ones so my tools could face down into the pockets vs. three that hold them by the handles - and poke into me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Using it around the house for low-lying cleaning projects, like scrubbing shower tile. I use both settings and each is comfortable. More importantly, both settings provide arms to help me get back up. It's lightweight, sturdy, simple to use, and well-worth what I paid for it. When it actually comes time to use one outside I might even buy another so this one stays clean.
customer_reviews.author: icu NURSE

customer_reviews.title: VERY Handy and Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for work in the yard, but realized it will do so much more! I now keep it in my trunk and can sit on it when visiting my husband's grave, or to a soccer game for my grandchildren. Very nice purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GrammieK

product_meta.title: Ohuhu Garden Kneeler and Seat with 2 Bonus Tool Pouches, 2-in-1 Foldable Garden Bench Garden Stools, Portable Kneeler for Gardening Gardeners
feature_bullets: ✿ HAPPY KNEES: This handy garden kneeler features an elevated kneeling pad that reduces aches from prolonged kneeling, and keeps your knees away from the muddy ground and grass
✿ KNEELING PAD & GARDEN CHAIR: Flips over to become a garden chair so you can tend to your long-stemmed plants and bigger shrubs in complete comfort (weight capacity: 330.69lbs/150kg)
✿ FOLDS EASILY: Comes assembled, and opens and closes in a quick snap so you can get down to your gardening as soon as the sun comes up
✿ STURDY AND LIGHTWEIGHT: Constructed with a steel frame and EVA for added toughness that takes any garden mishap, and plastic for grandmother-approved lifting
✿ TWO COMPLEMENTARY GARDENING TOOL POUCHES: Attach them to this garden chair with Velcro, and have your clippers, pullers and spades right by your side

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,451 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
